boat.name: Malin
boat.home_port: St Mawes, currently laid up ashore in Somerset.
boat.full_description:
When named 'Corystes' she was based on Hayling Island, then went to the Clyde, and was then renamed 'Malin'. The owner holds a copy of an original drawing scaled at 1/2in to 1ft, a revision dated 1975.

Original YSB8 engine replced in 2006 with Yanmar 15. No major changes to original design, but deck has been relaid at some point, and the original cockpit drains removed, now drains to the bilges. She is fitted with custom pulpit and guard rails.

In 2014 she has had a 35sqft topsail jib added to her sail wardrobe.
boat.short_description: 'Malin' cruises the coast between the Lizard and Exmouth, usually spending the summer holidays in St Mawes.

for_sales.sales_text:
"Malin" is a 24’ Mk1 Crabber, built 1977. I"ve owned her for 6 years and finally moving to a larger gaffer. Many features have been added to enable longer stays on board for cruising.

Kept undercover in a barn off season.

Sail includes Main, Jib, Stays’l,Tops’l (2), Jackyard Tops’l, Tops’l Jib. Yanmar 2YM15(2005). YL&CC Alloy yacht legs. Yabsco Sea Toilet with Holding Tank. Integral diesel & freshwater tanks. Coppercoat antifouling. Seago 230 Inflatable. SBS 3.5ton 4 wheel braked trailer.

June 2016 full survey on request.
